children.search: What do you write on a receipt when selling a car privately?
children.more: As soon as you've been paid for the car, you need to complete the following essential paperwork: Write a receipt and make two copies – one for you and one for your buyer. It should include the date, price, registration number, make and model, plus you and your buyer's names and addresses.

children.search: Can I sell my car privately with outstanding finance?
children.more: If you are selling a car with finance still outstanding there are two things you must do before you can legally sell it: Inform the finance company and ask them for the “settlement figure” they'll need from you to pay off your loan in full.

children.search: How do I delete an ad on DoneDeal?
children.more: Edit/Bump up/Withdraw/Remove/Spotlight Edit (change details of your ad) Bump up (put your ad back to the top of the search results) Withdraw (hide your ad temporarily eg if you're in negotiations with a buyer) Remove (remove it or mark as sold on DoneDeal) Spotlight (in certain sections)

children.search: How do I upload a picture on Done Deal?
children.more: Upload photos Transfer the images from your camera or phone to your computer. Go to DoneDeal and click on the Place ad. Click the "Add Photos/Video" button at the top of the page. Select the photo(s) from your computer (You can upload multiple photos at the same time by holding down the Ctrl key) More items...

It is never safe to use Western Union®, MoneyGram® or other similar money transfer companies to pay for goods for sale on DoneDeal, regardless of what the other person says. Never buy or sell to a foreign country.

questions.search: How do you pay for a car from a private seller?
questions.more: Use a cashier's check or money order to pay when purchasing a second-hand car. Use a cashier's check or money order to pay when purchasing a second-hand car. Walk away from the sale if they are trying to rush you. When buying a car privately, don't meet a seller at their private residence and don't meet alone. Jul 3, 2018

children.search: What are my rights when buying a used car?
children.more: If you buy a new or used car from a dealer and experience problems with it, you have some statutory rights under the Consumer Rights Act 2015. The Act states the car must be “of a satisfactory quality”, “fit for purpose” and “as described”. ... After 30 days you lose the short-term right to reject the goods.
children.article_header: Your rights if something is wrong with your car - Money Advice Service

children.search: When buying a car from a private seller Do you pay taxes?
children.more: Yes, you must pay sales tax when you buy a used car if you live in a state that has sales tax. However, you do not pay that tax to the individual selling the car. You will pay it to your state's DMV when you register the vehicle.Sep 6, 2018

children.search: What does watching mean on adverts IE?
children.more: Your watchlist is a self-curated list of adverts that can be easily accessed form your profile. ... For adverts on your watchlist, you will receive an alert for any new questions on that ad, any comments from the seller, if the price changes, or if the ad gets marked as sold or withdrawn.Dec 30, 2018
